description: Nikola Petrak, acting alone from his low-visibility zone, compiles and annotates encrypted evidence linking BCI score tampering to multiple Council factions, weighing the risk of public exposure.
Petrak leaks selected documents with commentary to trusted underground presses and dissident networks. As Council members detect the leak, they mobilize to spin the emerging story.

Stenograd’s newsfeeds are flooded with edited footage and claims from all Council factions, each blaming rivals for the BCI’s breakdown. Anonymous activists overlay inflammatory accusations, escalating public outrage.

City walls fill with graffiti, and crowds rally in contested squares. Civic life fractures as each group claims to represent the 'authentic' vision of Halden and the BCI, fueling rising unrest and distrust.

A new leak confirms BCI scores were manipulated by Council command. Massive protests erupt when proof emerges that a leading faction had rivals quietly blacklisted. With police reluctant to act, chaos spreads through the capital.
